main_text:
Objections || The Unreasonableness Objection
6.5 The Unreasonableness Objection

Public reason liberals often say many citizens are unreasonable, but
this claim meets powerful resistance due to its ambiguity. Others
object because uses of the reasonable privilege some over others, so
the standard is inegalitarian. (Bohman 2003, Friedman 2000). This
objection focuses on Rawlsian interpretations of PJP.
